intro: Hieracium andrasovszkyi subsp. doerfleri, commonly known as the Andrasovszky's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellowish to orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has a low-growing habit with a rosette of basal leaves and slender flowering stems. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
